translation: As a lamp placed in a windless spot does not flicker, so is the Yogi of a controlled mind, who practices Yoga in the Self, compared.
commentary: 6.19 As as? Lamp: lamp? Nivatasthah placed in a windless place? Not not? Ingte flicker? She that? Analogy simile? Smrita is thought? Yoginah of the Yogi? yatachittasya of one with controlled mind? yunjata of the practicing? Yoga the Yoga? Atmanah of the Self.Commentary This is a beautiful simile. Yogins hear this simile very often when they talk about concentration or steadiness or onepointedness of the mind. A steady mind will serve as a powerful searchlight to find out the hidden spiritual treasures of the Self.
